1.content: Hello! How can I assist you today?
SCM stands for Structural Causal Model. It is a representation of a system as a collection of variables and their causal relationships, typically used in causal inference and modeling.
can you broadly describe the SCM?

A Structural Causal Model (SCM) is a representation of a system as a collection of variables and their causal relationships. It consists of exogenous (latent) variables, endogenous (measured) variables, structural functions, and an exogenous distribution. SCMs are used in causal inference to model the effects of interventions and understand causal relationships in complex systems.
